page.title: 16PRINCIPAL FEATURES (a)
page.content: The principal features of the area seemed in the opinion of the local people to be firstly the village is divided into Nottinghamshire and Derbyshire by the river Meden. A good bus service to Chesterfield, Shirebrook and Mansfield, a very large chimney, the 'Meden Trail', the Swan Inn, the Old People's flats and a large traffic roundabout. The roundabout as well as being one of the principal features of Pleasley, preserves the character of the village but unfortunately has not been completed. The bus service is very popular and the local people seem very happy with the service, although one or two people criticised it, saying that the buses were either too early or too late.The chimney to some is an eyesore, while others think it is a landmark with character for Pleasley.
